conclusion: Apply principles of electrostatics and mechanics to solve the problem.
Identify given values: distance between plates \(d\), thickness of metal plate \(l\), acceleration due to gravity \(g\).
Electric field between parallel plates connected to constant voltage source is constant.
When metal plate is removed, electric field between plates decreases.
Force on particle \(P\) is given by \(F = qE\).
Net force on stationary particle is zero, so \(qE = mg\).
Substitute \(mg = g \times l\) into equation: \(a = \frac{g \times l}{q}\).
Assume unit charge \(q = 1\), final expression for acceleration is \(a = gl\).
Substitute \(l = 1\) for thickness of metal plate: \(a = gl = 1 \times 1 = 1 \, \text{m/s}^2\).
Problem involves understanding relationship between electric field, force on charged particle, and acceleration.
Using given values and principles of electrostatics and mechanics, calculate acceleration of particle.
Final answer: acceleration of particle \(P\) is \(1 \, \text{m/s}^2\).
